articles.title: Richard Anuszkiewicz, Whose Op Art Caught Eyes in the ’60s, Dies at 89 - The New York Times
articles.description: He was a pioneer in manipulating fundamental elements of art to create optical effects — and to make, as he put it, “something romantic out of a very, very mechanistic geometry.”
articles.content: Richard Anuszkiewicz, a pioneering practitioner of Op Art in the United States before that perception-altering style was even given a name in the 1960s, died on May 19 at his home in Englewood, N.J. … [+8099 chars]
